column2: et invocáte nomen ejus~; adnuntiáte inter gèntes ópera ejus. ^ Give glory to the Lord
column3: and call upon his name~; declare his works among the Gentiles.

column2: et psállite ei~; narráte òmnia mirabìlia ejus. ^ Sing to him
column3: yea sing praises to him~; relate all his wondrous works.

column1: 3 ^ Laŭdámini in nómine sancto ejus~; laĕtétur cor qŭaĕrèntium Dòminum. ^ Glory ye in his holy name~; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

column2: et confirmámini~; qŭaĕrite fáciem ejus sèmper. ^ Seek ye the Lord
column3: and be strengthened~; seek his face evermore.

column1: 5 ^ Mementóte mirabílium ejus qŭaĕ fecit~; prodìgia ejus
column2: et judìcia oris ejus. ^ Remember his marvellous works which he hath done~; his wonders
column3: and the judgments of his mouth.

column2: sèrvi ejus~; fílii Jacóbis
column3: elécti ejus. ^ O ye seed of Abraham
column4: his servant~; ye sons of Jacob

column1: 7 ^ Ìpse Dòminus Deus noster~; in univèrsa terra judìcia ejus. ^ He is the Lord our God~; his judgments are in all the earth.
8 ^ Mèmor fuit in sáĕculum testamenti sui~; vèrbi qŭod mandávit in mille generatiónes
column2: ^ He hath remembered his covenant for ever~; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations
et juramènti sui ad Isácum. ^ which he made to Abraham
column3: and his oath to Isaac.

column1: 10 ^ Et statúvit illud Jacóbi in praĕcèptum
column2: et Israhéli in testamèntum aĕtèrnum
column3: ^ And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law
column4: and to Israel for an everlasting testament

column2: «~Tìbi dabo terram Canaánis
column3: funìculum hereditátis vèstraĕ.~» ^ saying
column4: "To thee will I give the land of Canaan

column2: paŭcìssimi
column3: et ìncolaĕ ejus
column4: ^ When they were but a small number

column1: 13 ^ et pertransivérunt de gènte in gèntem
column2: et de regno ad pòpulum álterum. ^ and they passed from nation to nation
column3: and from one kingdom to another people.

column2: et corrìpuit pro eîs reges. ^ He suffered no man to hurt them
column3: and he reproved kings for their sakes.

column2: et in profétîs meîs nolíte malignári. ^ Touch ye not my anointed
column3: and do no evil to my prophets.

column2: et omne firmamèntum panis contrívit. ^ And he called a famine upon the land
column3: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread.

column1: 17 ^ misit ante eos vìrum~; in servum venundátus est Josef. ^ He sent a man before them~; Joseph
column2: who was sold for a slave.
ferrum pertransívit ánimam ejus
column3: ^ They humbled his feet in fetters~; the iron pierced his soul

column1: 19 ^ donec věníret vèrbum ejus~; elóqŭium Dòmini inflammávit eum. ^ until his word came~; the word of the Lord inflamed him.

column2: princeps populórum
column3: et dímisit eum. ^ The king sent and released him
column5: and he set him at liberty.

column2: et príncipem òmnis possessiónis suaĕ
column3: ^ He established him master of his house
column4: and ruler of all his possession

column1: 22 ^ ut erudíret príncipes ejus sicut semet ìpsum
column2: et sènes ejus prudèntiam docéret. ^ that he might instruct his princes as himself
column3: and teach his ancients wisdom.

column2: et Jacob áccola fuit in terra Chami. ^ And Israel went into Egypt
column3: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.

column2: et firmávit eum super inimícos ejus. ^ And he increased his people exceedingly
column3: and strengthened them over their enemies.

column1: 25 ^ Convèrtuit cor eórum ut odírent pòpulum ejus
column2: et dolum fácerent in sèrvos ejus. ^ He turned their heart to hate his people
column3: and to deal deceitfully with his servants.

column2: qŭem elégit ìpsum. ^ He sent Moses his servant~; Aaron the man whom he had chosen.

column1: 27 ^ Pósuit in eîs vèrba signórum suórum
column2: et prodigiórum in terra Chami. ^ He gave them power to show them signs
column3: and his wonders in the land of Cham.

column2: et obscurávit
column3: et non exacerbávit sermónes suos. ^ He sent darkness

column2: et occáĕsit pìsces eórum. ^ He turned their waters into blood
column3: and destroyed their fish.

column1: 30 ^ Édidit terra eórum ranas in penetrálibus regum ipsórum. ^ Their land brought forth frogs
column2: in the inner chambers of their kings.
et vênit cinómia et cìnifes in òmnibus fínibus eórum. ^ He spoke
column3: and there came divers sorts of flies and sciniphs in all their coasts.

column1: 32 ^ Pósuit plúvias eórum in grándinem~; ìgnem comburèntem in terra ipsórum. ^ He set their rain as hail~; a burning fire in the land.
33 ^ Et percùssit víneas eórum et ficùlneas eórum
column2: et contrívit lìgnum fínium eórum. ^ And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig trees
column3: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.

column2: et vênit locùsta
column3: et brúcus cujus non èrat númerus~; ^ He spoke
column5: and the bruchus of which there was no number~;

column1: 35 ^ et comédit omne foĕnum in terra eórum
column2: et comédit òmnem fructum terraĕ eórum. ^ and they devoured all the grass in their land
column3: and consumed all the fruit of their ground.

column1: 36 ^ Et percùssit omne primogènitum in terra eórum~; primìtias òmnis labóris eórum. ^ And he slew all the firstborn in their land~; the firstfruits of all their labour.
37 ^ Et edúxit eos cum argènto et aŭro
column2: et non èrat in tribúbus eórum infìrmus. ^ And he brought them out with silver and gold
column3: and there was not among their tribes one that was feeble.

column1: 38 ^ Laĕtáta est Aegìptus in profectióne eórum
column2: qŭia incúbuit tìmor eórum super eos. ^ Egypt was glad when they departed
column3: for the fear of them lay upon them.

column2: et ìgnem ut lucéret eîs per nòctem. ^ He spread a cloud for their protection
column3: and fire to give them light in the night.

column2: et vênit cotùrnix
column3: et pane caĕli saturávit eos. ^ They asked
column5: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

column2: et fluxérunt aqŭaĕ~; abivérunt in sicco flúmina~; ^ He opened the rock
column3: and waters flowed~; rivers ran down in the dry land.

column1: 42 ^ Qŭóniam mèmor fuit vèrbi sancti sui
column2: qŭod hábuit ad Ábraham púerum suum. ^ Because he remembered his holy word
column3: which he had spoken to his servant Abraham.

column1: 43 ^ Et edúxit pòpulum suum in exsultatióne
column2: et eléctos suos in laĕtìtia. ^ And he brought forth his people with joy
column3: and his chosen with gladness.

column2: et labóres populórum possedérunt~; ^ And he gave them the lands of the Gentiles
column3: and they possessed the labours of the people~;

column2: et legem ejus requírant. ^ that they might observe his justifications
column3: and seek after his law.
